text: Adult milestones hit everyone differently; landing my first lecturing gig sure did it for me. Suddenly you're shaping minds & there’s no textbook answer sheet! It puts your whole journey - those endless studies included - into stark perspective as more than just academic hustle.

Institutional biases are deep-rooted relics from past societal structures—even academia wasn't immune. It required constant proving of competence beyond male counterparts'. Adaptation involved mastering nuances—language change had subtle yet profound impacts during peer interactions and publishing work.
Seen plenty of eyebrow raises backpacking for fieldwork while male colleagues got nods; shrugged off assumptions by just delivering solid research no one could ignore!
